snippet: The released videos offer the first minute-by-minute account of the last-ditch effort to avert what would become the worst nuclear calamity since Chernobyl.
abstract: Videos released by Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant operator Tokyo Electric Power Company, under public pressure, confirm that company knew from the early hours of the 2011 crisis that multiple meltdowns were likely; also suggest that the Japanese government ordered company not to share the information; above all, videos depict mayhem at the plant and a profound lack of preparedness.

byline.contributor: Matthew L. Wald contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The released videos offer the first minute-by-minute account of the last-ditch effort to avert what would become the worst nuclear calamity since Chernobyl.

headline.seo: Fukushima Videos Shed Light on Chaos in Nuclear Crisis
headline.main: Videos Shed Light on Chaos at Fukushima as a Nuclear Crisis Unfolded
headline.print_headline: Videos Shed Light on Chaos at Fukushima as a Nuclear Crisis Unfolded
